headline: Why Lockheed Martin Stock Plunged Midday Today
summary: Lockheed Martin shares fell midday as its CFO was presenting at an industry conference.  Lockheed Martin could be a good choice for patient investors who are interested in income.  Shares of Lockheed Martin (NYSE: LMT) hovered around breakeven for most of the trading day on Wednesday before suddenly falling more than 3% around 1:30 p.m. ET.

headline: Lockheed Martin anticipates sooner-than-expected F-35 award
summary: The fighter jets in lot 19 could potentially be awarded sooner than the second half of this year, which was the company's earlier timeline, newly appointed CFO Evan Scott said at a Bank of America conference.  Lockheed's customer has told the company to expect lots 18 and 19 to be combined into a single contract, Scott added.  Last month, Lockheed beat expectations for quarterly profit and reaffirmed its annual forecasts, buoyed by resilient demand for its missile systems and fighter jets.

headline: 1 Magnificent Defense Stock Down 23% to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: Lockheed Martin has long-term defense contracts in a variety of different niches.  A large backlog, stock buybacks, and a growing dividend should help it generate steady returns.  Defense stocks can serve this need.
